intro: Onosma orientalis var. sintenisii, commonly known as the Persian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, though it is primarily appreciated for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
